title: FedEx Stock Is Plummeting Because Its Earnings Came Up Short
text:
FedEx Stock Is Plummeting Because Its Earnings Came Up Short

Text size

. Photograph by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

Express shipping giant FedEx missed Wall Street expectations for its fiscal first quarter ended in August, and the company cut its outlook for next year’s earnings. That double dose of bad news has FedEx stock down more than 9% in after-hours trading.

The move essentially wipes out all year-to-date gains in the stock, leaving FedEx far behind the 18% gain of the Dow Jones Industrial Average. Over the past year, FedEx (ticker: FDX) shares have fallen almost 40%, including Tuesday’s after-hours decline. The Dow, by comparison, is up about 7% over the past 12 months.
description: Express shipping giant FedEx missed Wall Street expectations for its fiscal first quarter ended in August, and the company cut its outlook for next year’s earnings. FedEx stock slid as a result.
